item.title: How I'm running Home Assistant in docker on NixOS
item.description: For the last few years I’ve been into home automation, and since I buy random stuff from different vendors and with various protocols, I use Home Assistant to tie it all together. My main home server is a NixOS box, but for a long while I was running home assistant on my old Arch mac mini, because it was such a chore to handle dependencies with the NixOS home assistant service.

item.title: Thomas Dybdahl - Life here is gold
Stuffed blue cheese burger with cream cheese, avocado and basil
item.description: photo by denisb I used 1 kg of ground beef for 4 burgers, and seasoned with salt, pepper, paprika powder, two ts of bbq sauce, a squirt of mint chilli sauce. To make the burgers, I use a stuffed burger press, and make a cup for the filling. To make the filling, take a box of cream cheese and whip it a bit to loosen. Dice an avocado, slice some basil leaves, and mix it in.

item.title: Emacs lsp-mode 7.0 released
item.description: LSP support in Emacs is first class, and this release improves it even further. The ability to have LSP support inside org-mode code blocks blow my mind.

item.title: Home Assistant 0.112 released
item.description: Always glad to see updates to my home automation system of choice. Performance improvements to logbook and history are much appreciated. I need to switch to the new z-wave integration soon.

item.title: Homemade magnetic drill
item.description: What an inspiring build video. Hope to some day build the skill set and workshop to be able to make something like that.
